Package com.midiwars.logic.instruments

Class Instrument

  • Object
    • Instrument
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Flute, Harp, MagBell

    public abstract class Instrument
extends Object
    A musical instrument.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Instrument.Warning
      Possible warnings when trying to play a midi timeline.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int activeKeybarIndex
      The currently active key bar.
      private boolean canHold
      True if the instrument can hold notes (ie note duration matters).
      private int heldKeybind
      The keyboard key that is currently being held down.
      private int idleKeybarIndex
      The active key bar before and after the midi timeline is played.
      static int KEYBAR_COOLDOWN
      Minimum amount of time needed in-between key bar changes (ms).
      private int[][] keybars
      Each line represents a key bar (in-game skill bar - usually an octave) and its slots.
      private String name
      Name of the instrument.
      static int NOTE_DURATION_LIMIT
      Upper limit to a note's duration (ms) - note will be played twice if duration is higher than this value.
      static int PAUSE_DURATION_LIMIT
      Upper limit to a pause's duration (ms) - longer pauses are probably due to errors in the midi file.
      private long previousKeybarChange
      System time of the previous key bar change (ms).
      private MyRobot robot
      Robot used to simulate system inputs.
      static int ROBOT_MAX_SLEEP
      Maximum amount of time (ms) Robot.delay() can sleep for.
      static int ROBOT_SLEEP
      Amount of time robot sleeps after a key bar change (ms).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Instrument​(String name, boolean canHold, int[][] keybars, int idleKeybarIndex)
      Creates a new Instrument object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      private boolean areNotesTooLong​(NoteEvent noteEvent)
      Checks if the given note goes over the duration limit.
      private boolean arePausesTooLong​(NoteEvent previousNoteEvent, NoteEvent noteEvent)
      Checks if there are pauses (time between events) that go over the duration limit.
      ArrayList<Instrument.Warning> canPlay​(MidiTimeline midiTimeline)
      Checks if the given midi timeline can be properly played by this instrument (ie no warnings pop up).
      private void changeKeybars​(int keybarIndex)
      Changes the active keybar to the given one.
      private int getKeybarIndex​(int key)
      Returns the index of the keybar given key (note) belongs to, taking into account active key bar, in order to avoid unnecessary keybar (octave) changes.
      private int getKeyIndex​(int key)
      Returns the index of given key (note) in a keybar.
      private boolean isInRange​(NoteEvent noteEvent)
      Checks if given note can be played by this instrument.
      private boolean isTooFast​(NoteEvent previousNoteOnEvent, NoteEvent noteEvent)
      Checks if the given note doesn't require key bar changes that are too fast, thus hindering playback.
      int play​(MidiTimeline midiTimeline, int startNote)
      Plays the given midi timeline.
      void preemptivelyChangeKeybars​(int i, ArrayList<NoteEvent> timeline)
      Looks into the future (starting from given position) to preemptively change keybars if needed.
      void returnToIdleKeybar​()
      Returns the instrument to the idle keybar.
      private int timeLeft​(long startTime, int delta)
      Calculates the time left to complete delta.

      • name

        private final String name
        Name of the instrument.

      • canHold

        private final boolean canHold
        True if the instrument can hold notes (ie note duration matters).

      • keybars

        private final int[][] keybars
        Each line represents a key bar (in-game skill bar - usually an octave) and its slots.

        private final int idleKeybarIndex
        The active key bar before and after the midi timeline is played.

        private int activeKeybarIndex
        The currently active key bar.

        Robot used to simulate system inputs.

        System time of the previous key bar change (ms).

        private int heldKeybind
        The keyboard key that is currently being held down.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Instrument

        public Instrument​(String name,
                  boolean canHold,
                  int[][] keybars,
                  int idleKeybarIndex)
        Creates a new Instrument object.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the instrument.
        canHold - If the instrument can hold notes.
        keybars - Each line represents a skill bar (usually an octave).
        idleKeybarIndex - The active key bar before and after the midi timeline is played.

    • Method Detail

      • timeLeft

        private int timeLeft​(long startTime,
                     int delta)
        Calculates the time left to complete delta.
        Parameters:
        startTime - Time countdown started.
        delta - Total amount of time to complete.
        Returns:
        The amount of time left to complete delta.

      • play

        public int play​(MidiTimeline midiTimeline,
                int startNote)
         throws AWTException
        Plays the given midi timeline.
        Parameters:
        midiTimeline - Midi timeline to play.
        startNote - Note (index) to start playback from.
        Returns:
        -1 If playback finished, next note (index) to play otherwise (ie playback was paused or stopped).
        Throws:
        AWTException - If the platform configuration does not allow low-level input control.

      • returnToIdleKeybar

        public void returnToIdleKeybar​()
        Returns the instrument to the idle keybar.

      • preemptivelyChangeKeybars

        public void preemptivelyChangeKeybars​(int i,
                                      ArrayList<NoteEvent> timeline)
        Looks into the future (starting from given position) to preemptively change keybars if needed.
        Parameters:
        i - Index of starting position in the timeline.
        timeline - Midi timeline to assess.

      • changeKeybars

        private void changeKeybars​(int keybarIndex)
        Changes the active keybar to the given one.
        Parameters:
        keybarIndex - New active keybar.

      • getKeybarIndex

        private int getKeybarIndex​(int key)
        Returns the index of the keybar given key (note) belongs to, taking into account active key bar, in order to avoid unnecessary keybar (octave) changes.
        Parameters:
        key - Key to assess.
        Returns:
        Key bar index. -1 if note can't be played.

      • getKeyIndex

        private int getKeyIndex​(int key)
        Returns the index of given key (note) in a keybar.
        Parameters:
        key - Key to assess.
        Returns:
        Key index. -1 if note can't be played.

      • canPlay

        public ArrayList<Instrument.Warning> canPlay​(MidiTimeline midiTimeline)
        Checks if the given midi timeline can be properly played by this instrument (ie no warnings pop up).
        Parameters:
        midiTimeline - Timeline to assess.
        Returns:
        List of warnings caused by given timeline.

      • isTooFast

        private boolean isTooFast​(NoteEvent previousNoteOnEvent,
                          NoteEvent noteEvent)
        Checks if the given note doesn't require key bar changes that are too fast, thus hindering playback.
        Parameters:
        previousNoteOnEvent - Previous NOTE_ON event assessed.
        noteEvent - Current note event being assessed.
        Returns:
        True if note will hinder playback, False otherwise.

      • isInRange

        private boolean isInRange​(NoteEvent noteEvent)
        Checks if given note can be played by this instrument.
        Parameters:
        noteEvent - Note event to assess.
        Returns:
        True if note is in range, False otherwise.

      • areNotesTooLong

        private boolean areNotesTooLong​(NoteEvent noteEvent)
        Checks if the given note goes over the duration limit.
        Parameters:
        noteEvent - Note event to assess.
        Returns:
        True if note is above the limit, False otherwise.

      • arePausesTooLong

        private boolean arePausesTooLong​(NoteEvent previousNoteEvent,
                                 NoteEvent noteEvent)
        Checks if there are pauses (time between events) that go over the duration limit.
        Parameters:
        previousNoteEvent - Previous note event assessed.
        noteEvent - Current note event being assessed.
        Returns:
        True if pause is above the limit, False otherwise.
